title: Category delete protection, smart category icons, unified logo, and password criteria hint

requirements.text: In the Sidebar component, user-created (custom) categories must show a delete (Ã—) button that removes them from localStorage and the sidebar. Default/built-in categories (Work, Personal, Education, Household, Shopping, Health, Other) must NOT show any delete button and cannot be deleted. Only categories the current user created should be deletable.

acceptanceCriteria: Default categories (Work, Personal, Education, Household, Shopping, Health, Other) have no delete button and cannot be removed
User-created custom categories display a visible delete (Ã—) icon next to their name in the sidebar
Clicking the delete icon on a custom category removes it from localStorage and immediately removes it from the sidebar list
Deleting a custom category does not affect tasks already assigned to that category
The currently active category is deselected (reverts to All Tasks) if the active category is deleted

requirements.text: Display the same Task Queue logo image on the Login page as is shown in the Dashboard header. Read the logo file path currently used in DashboardHeader.tsx and use that exact same tag (same src, same file from frontend/public/assets/generated/) in the Login page header/branding area. Remove any different, placeholder, or randomly generated logo from the Login page.

quotes: When comes to Logo in Login Page then same Logo it should be displayed in dashboard page not to display the random Logo

acceptanceCriteria: The Login page displays the same logo image file as the Dashboard header
The logo src path on the Login page matches the src path in DashboardHeader.tsx exactly
No different or placeholder logo appears on the Login page
The logo is rendered alongside the 'Task Queue' wordmark text on the Login page

requirements.text: In the Signup page, add a password criteria hint directly below the Password input field. Show the text 'Minimum 6 characters' in small helper text. Apply real-time validation feedback: while the user is typing in the password field, if the current value is fewer than 6 characters show the hint in red/error color; once 6 or more characters are entered show it in green/success color (or hide it). Also enforce this rule in the signup validation logic in frontend/src/utils/auth.ts â€” if the password is fewer than 6 characters, block signup and show a custom popup with the message 'Password must be at least 6 characters.'

quotes: In Signup page Password field there is no password criteria minimum 6 characters alter should be displayed right

acceptanceCriteria: A 'Minimum 6 characters' hint is visible below the Password field on the Signup page
The hint text turns red when the password input has fewer than 6 characters
The hint text turns green (or is hidden/checked) when the password input has 6 or more characters
Submitting the signup form with a password shorter than 6 characters is blocked
A custom popup with the message 'Password must be at least 6 characters.' is shown when the password is too short
The real-time feedback updates as the user types without requiring form submission

constraints: Default categories (Work, Personal, Education, Household, Shopping, Health, Other) must never be deletable under any circumstance
The logo used on the Login page must be the exact same file already used in DashboardHeader.tsx â€” do not generate a new logo image
